1.text: After these things the word of the LORD came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram: I [am] thy shield, [and] thy exceeding great reward.

2.text: And Abram said, Lord GOD, what wilt thou give me, seeing I go childless, and the steward of my house [is] this Eliezer of Damascus?

3.text: And Abram said, Behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and, lo, one born in my house is mine heir.

4.text: And, behold, the word of the LORD [came] unto him, saying, This shall not be thine heir; but he that shall come forth out of thine own bowels shall be thine heir.

5.text: And he brought him forth abroad, and said, Look now toward heaven, and tell the stars, if thou be able to number them: and he said unto him, So shall thy seed be.

6.text: And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.

7.text: And he said unto him, I [am] the LORD that brought thee out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give thee this land to inherit it.

8.text: And he said, Lord GOD, whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it?

9.text: And he said unto him, Take me an heifer of three years old, and a she goat of three years old, and a ram of three years old, and a turtledove, and a young pigeon.

10.text: And he took unto him all these, and divided them in the midst, and laid each piece one against another: but the birds divided he not.

11.text: And when the fowls came down upon the carcases, Abram drove them away.

12.text: And when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon Abram; and, lo, an horror of great darkness fell upon him.

13.text: And he said unto Abram, Know of a surety that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land [that is] not theirs, and shall serve them; and they shall afflict them four hundred years;

14.text: And also that nation, whom they shall serve, will I judge: and afterward shall they come out with great substance.

15.text: And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.

16.text: But in the fourth generation they shall come hither again: for the iniquity of the Amorites [is] not yet full.

17.text: And it came to pass, that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold a smoking furnace, and a burning lamp that passed between those pieces.

18.text: In the same day the LORD made a covenant with Abram, saying, Unto thy seed have I given this land, from the river of Egypt unto the great river, the river Euphrates:

19.text: The Kenites, and the Kenizzites, and the Kadmonites,

20.text: And the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Rephaims,

21.text: And the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.
